title: Elliot R. Wolfson - On Kabbalah & Jewish Mysticism (5 books)
description:
ELLIOT R. WOLFSON (b. 1956) is the Abraham Lieberman Professor of Hebrew and Judaic Studies at New York University.  He has published extensively in the area of Jewish mysticism and philosophy in the medieval and modern eras.  His work intersects with and contributes to a range of fields and disciplines, including philosophical hermeneutics, the history and phenomenology of religion, and theories of gender and eroticism.


In addition to six miscellaneous articles from scholarly journals, the following books are in PDF format:

* ALEF, MEM, TAU: Kabbalistic Musings on Time, Truth, and Death (University of California Press, 2006)

* LANGUAGE, EROS, BEING: Kabbalistic Hermeneutics and Poetic Imagination (Fordham University Press, 2004)

* LUMINAL DARKNESS: Imaginal Gleanings from Zoharic Literature (OneWorld, 2007)

* THROUGH A SPECULUM THAT SHINES: Vision and Imagination in Medieval Jewish Mysticism (Princeton University Press, 1994)

* VENTURING BEYOND: Law and Morality in Kabbalistic Mysticism (Oxford University Press, 2006)
